intro: Eschscholzia nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking orange to red petals and is typically found in rocky soils and open habitats. The plant belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known species like the common poppy. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Eschscholzia nevadensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with limited rainfall.
